title: activist pressure increases on twilio after anson takes stake
description: activist investor anson funds is pushing for a sale or business divestiture at twilio after building a stake in the enterprise software company.
author: rohan goswami
body: activist investors are pushing software maker twilio to sell the entire company, or divest one of its two business units comprising less than 20% of its revenue, two people familiar with the matter tell cnbc.

title: openai rival hugging face says it's seeing more client interest after sam altman fiasco
description: hugging face and cohere, which compete with openai, have both said they've seen increased inquiries from clients following the drama surrounding sam altman
author: hayden field
body: artificial intelligence startup hugging face says it's seeing increased interest from potential customers following the chaos at rival openai.

title: amazon wants businesses to use its palm-scanning tech to let employees into the office
description: amazon is pitching the palm-based service as a way for employees to swipe their hand to enter an office or to access sensitive company data
author: annie palmer
body: is expanding its palm-scanning technology beyond grocery stores and is rolling out a version that's designed for the business world.

title: e-commerce stocks rally after black friday shoppers spend record online
description: shares of e-commerce stocks such as shopify, etsy and wayfair all surged monday on strong black friday online sales and rosy projections for cyber monday.
author: annie palmer
body: shoppers turned out in full force on thanksgiving and over the black friday weekend, largely shunning physical stores for the comfort of clicking "buy online" from their couches.

title: uk regulators say adobe's $20 billion figma acquisition could harm competition
description: the competition and markets authority said adobe's proposed acquisition of figma could harm the u.k.'s digital design sector.
author: ashley capoot
body: britain's top competition watchdog said tuesday that

title: amazon touts ‘record-breaking’ sales in kickoff to holiday shopping season
description: the company said the period of nov. 17 to cyber monday marked its "biggest ever" holiday shopping event compared to the same 11-day stretch last year.
author: annie palmer
body: said tuesday it rang up "record-breaking" sales in the run-up to cyber monday as consumers, still pinched by inflation, sought discounts.

title: amazon announces q, an ai chatbot for businesses
description: the product, announced at amazon web services' reinvent conference, is amazon's latest effort to challenge microsoft and google in productivity software.
author: jordan novet
body: on tuesday announced a new chatbot called

title: meta updates political advertising rules to cover ai-generated images and videos
description: meta details more updates to its political advertising policy, taking in account ai.
author: jonathan vanian
body: revealed on tuesday more details about its policies on political ads, including a mandate that advertisers disclose when they use artificial intelligence to alter images and videos in certain political ads.

title: apple is trying to unwind its goldman sachs credit card partnership
description: the move would end one of the highest-profile partnerships between giants in the tech and banking sectors.
author: kif leswing
body: has given

title: pinduoduo transaction revenue surges 315% as chinese consumers hunt for bargains
description: pinduoduo on tuesday posted more than 90% growth in third-quarter revenue, outpacing that of alibaba, as consumers increasingly look for bargains.
author: evelyn cheng, sheila chiang
body: consumers in china are hunting for bargains when they spend, the latest earnings from online retailers show.

title: okta hackers stole data on all customer support users in major breach
description: the hack was worse than initially believed, with every client having some data stolen in the breach, the cybersecurity company warned.
author: rohan goswami
body: hackers who compromised

title: global smartphone sales rebound in october after declining for more than 2 years: counterpoint
description: the global smartphone market grew 5% year-on-year in october after months of negative growth, said counterpoint research.
author: sheila chiang
body: global smartphone sales rose in october after declining for 27 straight months on a year-on-year basis, led by a recovery in emerging markets,

title: china's alibaba shakes up cloud unit management after scrapping the division's ipo
description: the shakeup comes after a surprise move by alibaba last week to cancel the highly-anticipated initial public offering of its cloud unit.
author: arjun kharpal
body: has begun an overhaul of its cloud computing unit, bringing in veterans to new leadership positions, as it looks to revive the division after cancelling its public listing.

title: google maps changed colors and some people are upset, including a former designer
description: google maps now has grey roads, teal water, and mint-green parks. the change happened some time ago, but was widely noticed over thanksgiving travel season.
author: jake piazza
body: if you want to spark a good-hearted debate at the office water cooler, ask your coworkers what they think about the new

title: israel hosts wartime visit by elon musk, eyes starlink for gaza
description: israel hosted elon musk on monday, saying it had reached an agreement in principle for using his spacex company's starlink communications in the gaza strip.
body: israel hosted

title: bitcoin rises to new high for the year friday above $38,000
description: crypto prices have recovered from a big dip earlier in the week, with bitcoin hitting a new high for the year on friday.
author: tanaya macheel
body: have recovered from a big dip earlier in the week, with bitcoin hitting a new high for 2023 on friday.

title: tesla beats claim that it fired factory workers amid union campaign
description: a national labor relations board regional official tossed out a complaint filed by workers united, a union seeking to organize at tesla's new york gigafactory.
body: a u.s. labor board has dismissed claims that

title: sensetime plunges after short seller alleges the chinese ai firm inflated revenue
description: sensetime said it believes grizzly research's report is "without merit and contains unfounded allegations and misleading conclusions and interpretations."
author: arjun kharpal
body: shares of

title: tiktok owner bytedance axes hundreds of jobs in gaming unit as it scales back ambition
description: over the past few years, bytedance has made an aggressive push into gaming in a bid to challenge other gaming giants like china's tencent and netease.
author: arjun kharpal
body: tiktok parent company bytedance is cutting hundreds of jobs in its gaming division, a person familiar with the matter told cnbc, marking a significant retreat from a segment it has invested billions of dollars in to challenge market leader tencent.

title: amazon announces new ai chip as it deepens nvidia relationship
description: aws will host a computing cluster for nvidia to use. simultaneously, aws announced a new chip for training ai models, an nvidia gpu alternative.
author: jordan novet
body: amazon's aws cloud unit has announced new chips for customers to build and run artificial intelligence applications on, as well as plans to offer access to nvidia's latest chips.

title: flying taxi firm lilium receives eu approval for its electric jets
description: air taxi firm lilium has been granted eu approval to design and operate its electric vertical takeoff and landing vehicles globally.
author: ryan browne
body: , a german air taxi firm, has received regulatory approval to design and operate its electric vertical takeoff and landing vehicles, the company said monday.

title: coinbase ceo says crypto industry can turn the page after historic binance settlement
description: the crypto industry can close the chapter on a litany of scandals after binance was hit with a historic settlement, coinbase ceo brian armstrong told cnbc.
author: ryan browne
body: the crypto industry can finally close the chapter on a litany of scandals and problems after binance was hit with a historic settlement by the u.s. department of justice,

title: finnish startup varjo launches new $3,990 mixed-reality headset to take on apple, microsoft
description: finnish tech startup varjo launched its newest headset monday, the xr-4. it'll compete with similar headsets from the likes of microsoft, and apple.
author: ryan browne
body: finnish mixed-reality startup varjo on monday launched its latest headset, the xr-4, a product it hopes to sell to large enterprise firms.

title: irobot shares plunge 17% after eu warns amazon deal ‘may restrict competition’
description: the european commission said it found that amazon may have the ability to prevent or degrade irobot rivals' access to its online site.
author: annie palmer
body: shares of

title: binance founder changpeng zhao ordered by judge to stay in u.s. ahead of prison sentencing
description: a federal judge on monday ordered binance ex-ceo changpeng zhao to remain in the u.s. at least temporarily after his guilty plea last week.
author: mackenzie sigalos
body: binance founder changpeng zhao, who

title: apple iphone maker foxconn to invest $1.5 billion in india as it looks to build beyond china
description: hon hai precision industries will invest $1.54 billion in an indian subsidiary for "operational needs," and hire builders for a to-be-announced project.
author: rohan goswami
body: will invest more than $1.5 billion in an indian construction project to fulfill the

title: tesla sues swedish government after postal workers allegedly block license plate deliveries
description: tesla filed a lawsuit against the swedish transport agency on monday.
author: ashley capoot
body: filed a lawsuit against the swedish transport agency on monday after postal workers began to block deliveries of license plates for the company's cars.

title: irobot shares close up 39% on report amazon deal set to get eu approval
description: shares of irobot, the maker of roomba vacuums, closed up about 39% friday after a report said the european union is set to approve amazon's acquisition.
author: todd haselton
body: shares of

title: european tech funding halves to $45 billion, back to pre-covid levels — but ai is a bright spot
description: overall funding for european venture-backed companies is projected to decline 45% in 2023 from a year ago, according to vc firm atomico.
author: ryan browne
body: venture capital investment into europe's tech industry plunged by half in 2023 as investors continued to reel from the effects of high interest rates, according to data from venture capital firm atomico.

title: nvidia shares close down on report it delays china ai chip designed to comply with u.s. export rules
description: reuters, citing two sources familiar with the matter, reported that nvidia told chinese customers that it is delaying the launch of an ai chip that is designed to comply with u.s. export rules until the first quarter of next year.
author: arjun kharpal
body: is delaying a new artificial intelligence chip for china that has been designed to comply with u.s. export restrictions, according to
